channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Fall More Than Expected
item.description: U.S. crude oil inventories fell more than expected last week amid a decline in imports, while production and refinery capacity use held steady, accord...

item.title: Volvo Cars cuts margin and revenue aims after ditching 2030 electric vehicle target
item.description: The Swedish automaker is trimming its earnings margin goal for 2026 due to "increased complexity especially in relation to global trade and tariffs."

item.title: How Investors Can Play the Presidential Election
item.description: History offers a guide as to how the stock market fares in an election year under Democratic vs. Republican administrations.

item.title: Dollar Tree shares plunge 22% after discounter cuts full-year forecast
item.description: Dollar stores, in particular, have felt pinched as their core customer makes trade-offs after a prolonged period of pricier food and everyday costs.

item.title: Buyout Shops Go From Boom to Bust to…Meh
item.description: There is some easing of the drought for private-equity firms, but don’t call it a bounceback yet.

item.title: Dick's Sporting Goods blows past earnings estimates but issues cautious guidance ahead of 2024 election
item.description: Theft at Dick's Sporting Goods had previously impacted its profits but the company now appears to be past those issues.

item.title: Apple Needs Time to Be on Its Side for AI iPhones
item.description: Wall Street is seeing moderate iPhone sales gains over the next two years, as AI features will roll out slowly.

item.title: Klarna rival Zilch posts first profit and appoints ex-Aviva CEO to board ahead of IPO
item.description: Philip Belamant, Zilch's CEO, told CNBC the firm was able to hit profitability by growing rather than cutting back like other fintechs have done.

item.title: Affirm to Profit Soon From Buy Now, Pay Later
item.description: Lower interest rates and growing volume will be tailwinds.

item.title: MongoDB shares surge as high as 16% on guidance boost
item.description: MongoDB delivered stronger results than analysts had been looking for, partly because of better cloud consumption activity than expected.
